Ecological Value Card: This report summarizes the ecological value of areas within this plan from 1 (least valuable) to 10 (most valuable). Plans should consider protecting areas of greater ecological value.
Ecological Value Card - learn more:
🎯 Planning Objective: there is no specific objective/target for ecological value.

🗺️ Source data: Ecological valuation map from Poland MSP.

📈 Report: The area within the plan at each ecological value was summed. Percentages are calculated by taking this sum and dividing it by each total ecological value area. If the plan includes multiple areas that overlap, the overlap is only counted once.
Ecosystem Services Card - learn more:
🎯 Planning Objective: there is no specific objective/target for ecological value.

🗺️ Source data: Ecological valuation map from HELCOM ecosystem service assessment.

📈 Report: Percentages are calculated by summing the areas of value within the MPAs in this plan, and dividing it by total ecosystem services value. If the plan includes multiple areas that overlap, the overlap is only counted once.
Ecosystem Services Card 1: This report summarizes the percentage of ecological value that overlaps with this plan. Plans should consider protecting areas of greater ecological value.
Fishing Effort Card - learn more:
ℹ️ Overview: Hours at sea is used as a measure of fishing effort. This report is specifically focused on bottom trawling, a fishing practice that herds and captures the target species, like ground fish or crabs, by towing a net along the ocean floor (NOAA Fisheries).

🎯 Planning Objective: No specific planning objective.

🗺️ Source data:

📈 Report: Percentages are calculated by summing fishing effort within MPAs in this plan, and dividing it by the total fishing effort of the planning area. If the plan includes multiple areas that overlap, the overlap is only counted once.
Fishing Effort Card 1: This report summarizes the proportion of bottom trawling fishing effort that is within this plan. The higher the percentage, the greater the potential impact to the fishery if access or activities are restricted.
Impact Areas Card - learn more:
ℹ️ Overview: The impact index is an index for all pressures and their relationship with ecosystem components. The index showcases the main impact areas.

🎯 Planning Objective: No specific planning objective.

🗺️ Source data:

📈 Report: Percentages are calculated by summing the areas of value within the MPAs in this plan, and dividing it by the total impact value of the planning area. If the plan includes multiple areas that overlap, the overlap is only counted once.
Impact Areas Card 1: This report summarizes overlap with the impact index of Gdańsk Bay, an index for all pressures and their relationship with ecosystem components. Plans should consider the consequences of overlapping with high impact areas.
Shipping Density Card - learn more:
ℹ️ The four types of shipping vessels noted in this report are: passenger shipping, touristic shipping (coastal recreation), fishery shipping (for all activities including the tracks from the ports to fishery grounds), and all shipping registered by the AIS system.

🎯 Planning Objective: No specific planning objective.

🗺️ Source data: Shipping density data (ships no. per 1 sq. km) extracted from AIS system or 2 years (2018-2019).

📈 Report: Percentages are calculated by summing shipping density counts within MPAs in this plan, and dividing it by the shipping density counts of the planning area. If the plan includes multiple areas that overlap, the overlap is only counted once.
Shipping Density Card 1: This report summarizes the proportion of ships over the years 2018-2019 that overlap with this plan, using data on ship density in the planning area. Plans should consider the potential impact on shipping if access is restricted.
SizeCard - learn more:
🎯 Planning Objective: No specific objective

🗺️ Source Data: HELCOM

📈 Report: The total area of the plan was calculated, along with the total area under high protection and total area under medium protection. Overlap was only counted once, and if zones of different protection levels overlap, only the highest protection level is counted.
